IP_PART25_2_syn_1:
Procedure:
- BAL RUL.
- ENB nav to Lingula.
- Radial EBUS confirm.
- TBNA and Forceps Bx of Lingula lesion under fluoro.
IP_PART25_2_syn_2: A comprehensive diagnostic bronchoscopy was performed. Bronchoalveolar lavage was first completed in the right upper lobe. Electromagnetic navigation bronchoscopy was then utilized to locate a lingular lesion, confirmed via radial EBUS. Transbronchial needle aspiration and forceps biopsies were obtained under fluoroscopic guidance.
IP_PART25_2_syn_3: Codes: 31624 (BAL RUL), 31627 (Nav), 31654 (REBUS), 31629 (TBNA Lingula), 31628 (Forceps Bx Lingula). Distinct procedures performed on separate sites/lobes.
IP_PART25_2_syn_4:
Steps:
1. Airway inspection.
2. BAL RUL.
3. ENB to Lingula.
4. REBUS check.
5. TBNA Lingula.
6. Forceps biopsy Lingula.
IP_PART25_2_syn_5: did the bronch today bal in the rul then used the enb to get to that spot in the lingula radial ebus saw it fine did some needle biopsies and forceps bites using fluoro to see.
IP_PART25_2_syn_6: Flexible bronchoscopy included BAL of the RUL. ENB navigation was used to reach a lingular lesion, confirmed by radial EBUS. TBNA and forceps biopsies were obtained under fluoroscopy.
IP_PART25_2_syn_7:
[Indication]
Lung lesion.
[Anesthesia]
Moderate.
[Description]
BAL RUL. ENB to Lingula. REBUS confirmation. TBNA and forceps biopsies obtained.
[Plan]
Await path.
IP_PART25_2_syn_8: We started with a flexible bronchoscopy and performed a BAL in the RUL. Then, using ENB navigation, we targeted a lesion in the Lingula. We confirmed it with radial EBUS and took both TBNA and forceps biopsies under fluoroscopy.
IP_PART25_2_syn_9: Bronchoscopy with lavage in the RUL was conducted. ENB navigation located the lingular lesion, verified by radial EBUS. Needle aspiration and forceps samples were acquired under fluoroscopic guidance.
